poem:
Title: Tick-tock of Time

In London's lecture hall, a rendezvous,
Finer than Swiss craft, drawing the curious few;
Plucked from time, spun in British hues,
Tick-tocks chiming a melody of cues.
Neither Paris nor Milan may outdo,
Timekeepers borne on Isles anew. 
Celebrating seconds, collectors accrue,
Out time's cloth, treadle spun, simple, true, 
Through pendulum's arc, our story grew.
